result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shyra Teasha Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shyra Teasha Jackson appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Shyra Teasha Jackson.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status conference. Defendant no longer wants to be represented by Attorney Wentz; Defendant wants to represent herself, pro se. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Branch 02. Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Defense's Motion to Withdraw
Received and Filed: Pretrial SUPERVISION Report 11.01.2022
Received and Filed: Attorney Haley Wentz

Defendant Shyra Teasha Jackson in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Shyra Teasha Jackson.  Prosecuting Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-27-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 09-19-2022
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Shyra Teasha Jackson in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Shyra Teasha Jackson.  Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings and previously ordered bail.  Defense waives time limits for prelim and requests prelim date.  Case adjourned for prelim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Doctor's Report Dated August 31, 2022

Defendant Shyra Teasha Jackson in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Doctor's Report Return. Defense counsel requests matter be calendared in accordance with case set before Judge Watts, Br 15. Court grants request and adjourns matter for an additional Doctor's Report Return to Br 02.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Competency Evaluation No Show Letter, filed

Defendant Shyra Teasha Jackson in court with Attorney Joel Alan Mogren; both appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Amended Supervision Report

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Shyra Teasha Jackson not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle in person appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Mogren tested COVID postive and needs more time to meet with client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shyra Teasha Jackson not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MJM (d.o.b. 3/18/87)

Defendant Shyra Teasha Jackson in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Shyra Teasha Jackson in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shyra Teasha Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  For reasons stated on the record, court dismissed enhancer of count 2. State to file an amended complaint. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
